summary_points: 1. Steel Dynamics, Inc. completed a $1 billion notes offering on March 12, 2025, receiving net proceeds of approximately $972 million after expenses.
2. The company plans to use the net proceeds from the sale of the notes for general corporate purposes, which may include repayment of its 2.400% Notes due 2025.
3. The Notes are senior unsecured obligations, ranking equally with existing and future senior indebtedness but subordinated to secured indebtedness and all subsidiary liabilities.
1. AES Corp announced on March 12, 2025, a proposed public offering of senior notes due 2032 and a cash tender offer to purchase all outstanding 3.300% Senior Notes due 2025.
2.  The tender offer involves $900,000,000 of outstanding 3.300% Senior Notes due 2025.
3. The success of the tender offer is contingent upon AES obtaining sufficient debt financing by March 21, 2025 (or an extended date).
1. Emerson Electric Co. completed its acquisition of Aspen Technology, Inc. on March 12, 2025.
2. Approximately 72% of AspenTech's outstanding shares (excluding those held by Emerson and its subsidiaries, and directors and officers of both companies) were tendered in the offer.

3.  The acquisition of AspenTech was completed on March 12, 2025, with each remaining AspenTech share (excluding those already owned by Emerson and those subject to appraisal rights) converted into the right to receive $265 in cash.
1. Centene Corp reaffirmed its 2025 adjusted diluted earnings per share (EPS) guidance of greater than $7.25 on March 12, 2025.

2.  The company's presentation at the Barclays 27th Annual Global Healthcare Conference on March 12, 2025, included non-GAAP financial measures, which the company believes provide a clearer picture of its core business performance.

3. Centene Corp's future performance is subject to various risks, including competition, healthcare cost fluctuations, and changes in government healthcare regulations (including potential changes to the ACA).
1. On March 10, 2025, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. entered into an underwriting agreement for a $1.5 billion public offering of senior notes, with an anticipated closing date of March 24, 2025.
2.  The offering consists of $875 million in 4.212% senior notes due 2026 and $625 million in 4.319% senior notes due 2028.
3. Net proceeds from the offering will fund a portion of the acquisition of ZT Systems; if the acquisition fails, the funds will be used for general corporate purposes.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$646,928,533.70 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of March 11, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On March 11, 2025,  21,198,812 Class A shares and 10,459,772 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3. News Corp's future share repurchases are subject to market conditions, the market price of its stock, and other factors, with no guarantee of further purchases.
